intro: Solanum luteovirescens, commonly known as the yellow-green nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that start green and mature to a reddish color. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The species is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique foliage and flowers.
